Reviews.Title: Super fast
Reviews.Author: L. COPAS "Bookwoman"
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't done everything on it yet that this computer can do, I am very happy with it.  It is lightning fast,and I don't have to wait and wait for things to appear.  Very light (I wish I could open it with one hand, though) and easy to move. Screen resolution is marvelous, sound is great. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE HARDSHIP..
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I am a computer geek (lol) and this wasn't what I thought AT ALL. This was my third Dv7 from HP (customized 2 & were order from HP, 1 ordered from amazon) and they all had the same issues: Windows 7 runs ok but, it causes a sound problem for the laptop. The ACPI.sys file (in Windows 7) causes real-time audio skips, jumps, and cracks. That means when you listen to a song (i.e. on iTunes), stream music, watch a blu-ray movie, or a video on youtube, you will experince sound glitchs throughout the playtime. Second, programs run slower when ac adapter is plugged in. Next, the batterlife is ok but, it's not close to 5 hours. And thats running on "power saver" option. Then, the laptop get very hot, even with being lifted little with the 9-cell battery. Finally, HP customer care tech support is CRAP. Their techs have no idea what they are doing. They are extremely poorly trained, you get the absolute run around with trouble-shooting any issue and they are located in India so it is diffcult to understand them. You can tell they are reading off a script, when trouble-shooting your issue and calls get dropped alot.I looked up some forums on the internet, and alot of ppl are having very simlar or the same problems, especially with HP's customer service.Now I dont know if you going to have the same issue(s) with yours, I'm just saying 3 of mines did..

Reviews.Title: not worth the price
Reviews.Author: Yelekeri "mahesh yelekeri"
Reviews.Content: When I saw the specs of the laptop I was so excited, couldn't wait to get hold of it. But after using it for a few weeks, really very disappointed.Pros: - Internet browsing is a breeze, page loading is really super fast - In spite of someone mentioned that the keyboard is not so good, I do like the keyboard layout, its strong and you have the confidence that it would not break so easily.Cons: - I cannot, let me be very clear, I cannot use the mouse pad at all, its completely erraraneous and very hard. So I am using a wireless mouse. Most of the time I find the mouse first and then look where I kept the laptop. - display sucks, just forget about clarity - finger print reader is a nuasance. 4 out of 5 times it doesn't work. So to login to the machine, I do have to scan my finger, wait for it to process (probably 4-5 seconds), scan my finger again ..... and at one time it works. What the hell, just type the password. - audio did stuttered a few times, I thought its the music file itself. But the same song works fine in the same laptop. - No firewire or usb3.0 ports!

Reviews.Title: Not as a fast I thought, but it is ok...
Reviews.Author: LUIS RAUL
Reviews.Content: The size, is great.The details about the "argento style" is very good.The size of the disc is for my needs.The the hertz of the cpu is ok.The battery life, it is almost 5 hours...not 5.25, but it is ok.The fact to have blu-ray is a good advantage for movies.The kind of video card... is not the best.... it is a medium kind, do not support physx, but with the appropiate driver could support stereographic for 3d (haven't found yet but the specs says it support), this card was one of the first one in the world to support Directx 11 for laptops.Not as a fast as I thought for 6gb on memory, but still it is fast.Overall great laptop for the price.No problems yet!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money....
Reviews.Author: Akeem
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop as a replacement to a Toshiba that I had purchased that was recalled and I regret having purchased this laptop. The first day after taking it from the box and starting it up it crashed and I was given a blue screen believe it or not. It also gets extremely hot when in use, and I experience a lot more crashes when trying to view high demand videos which I suspect might be a video card issue. Overall I would not recommend buying this laptop at all.

Reviews.Title: miserable  !!!
Reviews.Author: star_sea
Reviews.Content: I have been use this laptop for several months, everything with it is good,but if you plan to use this laptop for more than one year, then don't buy this! My hard drive is broken suddenly while I was playing online games, and I call the tech support, they told me, because this is the newest technology, this machine is still on experiment, this problem is  normal. and they ask me to send my laptop back they will replace a hard drive for me. but hey! you gonna keep extend your warranty to ensure that you can still using the same laptop next year,because this problem is normal, you never know when your hard drive broken down again and again, and if you don't extend the warrany, you may need spend more dollars to keep buying new hard drive. and if you do extend the warrany, hey , this lap is not only 1200, it may be 1500 or even more depending on how many years of warrany you will need to buy or how many hard drive you needto change. plus, think about the two weeks you are sending your laptop back having your problem fixed. not only your stuff in your laptop is all deleted, but also you cant use it for two weeks~~!!

Reviews.Title: My last HP notebook - Do not buy it!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this machine is a abomination to the eyes of god. I had a pavilion dv6, got some troubles but decided to try again the hp pavilions. This year I buyied this notebook. intel i7, 6GB, 1TB, etc.. what could I hope? A great notebook, but I don`t know what HP had done, they was able to put all this characteristics of cpu, mem, etc and build a very bad product. Well, to start, 2 months after buy it, the wired network failed. More 1 month and the processor keeps at very high temperature. A simple youtube video or mp3 and the cpu goes to 80C. If I keeps watching the video, it reaches ~105C and auto-shutdown. Obviously that the cooler try to do its job, not without a big noise, but it is not enough. At the end of the day, I buyied a machine that must be replaced soon. Never more with HP. For now on, I will try Dell or Apple. If you are thinking about buy this notebook, please check for more reviews. Don`t let him impress you with i7,x-GB, y-TB. Read carefully the reviews and buy a descent machine.

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to love this thing!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Storm
Reviews.Content: I thought about this purchase long and hard, this is my 3rd HP product and the first two did not disappoint.  This thing is lightening fast which is awesome and no matter what I throw at it will keep clocking.So, I have had it now for about 2 months and here are my pros/cons:PROS: fast, reliable, good battery life, good screen resolution, nice audio for video conferencingCONS: There is no light to tell you if the num lock is on or off, the keys are not the friendliest for ladies hands even with short nails, THE MOUSE PAD IS AWFUL!!!So, to elaborate, there is no scrolling function for navigating webpages (though once in awhile it will do it so I guess there might be a way I just don't know how to do it), the buttons are hard to push and I find that after filing some 1000 emails around in Outlook that I receive each week, my fingers ache and I long for my old HP mouse (similar to the one pictured where they show the fingerprint reader)Overall, I feel like it was a fair purchase but it was not worth what I paid for it at all, I am overall disappointed but I am now stuck with it :(UPDATE: Almost one year later...I still hate this laptop and I am considering buying a MAC this thing locks up all the time, the fan won't stop running despite every BIOS update that HP has put out, all the letters have worn off the keys, it crashes all the time and the mousepad is still nightmare...overall still very disappointed in a $1200 machine. Update...there is a scrolling function but it is a joke at best.

Reviews.Title: Not so Good as it see
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: First, i'll be cleared, on hardware this machine is amazing. Very nice design, very thin (considering that is HP).The only thing on hardware that is pretty annoying, is the fact that for this price i spect FULL HD (please HP 17.3 inches) and the lack of Bluetooth.ok, now comes the rude stuff:  I see silver on the product images, but i don't know why they ship me a soft purple (thanks a lot now i can find the soft side of my manliness). Then the package came with no protection at all only one box into another, but arrived with no problems (just by lucky). The mousepad is terrible, scrolling is a headache.For now thats all.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Giorgi Bekarashvili
Reviews.Content: This is Great Laptop for the price, but it's not perfect. Something is missing but still don't know what. It's great and powerful, but previous DV7 was more comfortable.If you need powerful laptop for good price this the one you must buy.Still I've not ever seen such comfortable and powerful laptop together.Must byeP.S. Touchpad was better on previous models.

Reviews.Title: Awesome All-Rounder
Reviews.Author: Jared Mars
Reviews.Content: This machine does it all, and in pretty decent time.  The 64 bit system really shines when everything else is built for it, and this notebook takes full advantage of everything.  The 9 cell battery provides plenty of time away from the power which is great considering this is a big 17.3" machine.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: good laptop at affordable price
Reviews.Author: Luke Johnson
Reviews.Content: bought this for my wife and boy did she love it. only con is its size, yet you are glad it is that big when you really need the processing this thing was made for. by that i mean editing pics or editing video, or both at the same time. amazon had a better price than best buy on the same laptop.

Reviews.Title: Beware HP Laptops have Blu-ray copyright issues
Reviews.Author: D. Daley "bigd-deluxe"
Reviews.Content: I like my HP dv7 laptop but beware the Blu-ray drives give a lot of errors like "content is not allowed to play in the current display mode".  If you plan to watch blu-ray discs think twice about HP laptops.

Reviews.Title: Screen Performance Very Poor, Finger Pad a Nightmare!
Reviews.Author: The Anti-Genius
Reviews.Content: I own the AMD version of this machine because I personally watched Intel destroy a great young company by stealing it's technology. The display screen on these machines has the worst off axis view-ability I've seen since the first LCD screens hit the market.The concept of integrating the mouse buttons under the touch pad was singly the most poop brained idea anyone's had in computer design in... forever! The entire surface is active all the time so it constantly gets confused over which finger is doing what. And there's no option to disable tapping on the control surface, which I INSIST on being able to disable. The single finger approach is no better as touching the button are (which is part of the pad surface)causes the pointer to move and on small buttons or those fine box borders, this is absolutely maddening!I thought those issues were bad enough until the machine literally just rebooted in the middle of writing this! Thank you Amazon for restoring this page on relaunch. BTW, Thank you microsoft for your last three miserable "operating systems"!Did I say that the DVD/Blu-Ray drive is a royal pain in the butt to open?

Reviews.Title: HP Changes a great product?
Reviews.Author: Bradley J. Thomas "CHEMLIGHT"
Reviews.Content: well there previous version was far better.new version Pros:Battery is betterbattery power led is a neat feature.New version Cons:Metal finish is cheap and thin and can dent and bend in travel.not lid latch to lock lid for travel.fingerprint reader is annoying every time you access the internet.gets overly hot.(SPECIFIC TO THE AMD MODELS)i love AMD for desktop.(but go INTEL if you buy a laptop) you'll thank your self.wifi works when it wants to.windows 7 is junk.F keys don't work like they use to.(for those that don't use F keys,alt + f5 refreshes window, alt f4 closes window ect.....took away touch audio controls.touch pad buttons integrated into touch pad, right or left clicking makes mouse drag off your icon when u try to click on it.also went to flat keys, no more ergonomic keys for comfort and control.ou end up pressing multiple keysno tv tuner option available anymore.pretty much this computer is junk, and hp should revert to there older version.(Solid stable machine - VISTA)just my oppinion. corp. companies always have to mess up something good.

Reviews.Title: Great choice in a laptop!
Reviews.Author: Chantell O'donnell "College Lady"
Reviews.Content: 100% happy with my laptop! I needed it for school when my other one hated me...and it needed to be updated. It offered all the perks I needed...with the addition of a fingerprint reader, blu-ray, 1TB drive and 6GB memory. You will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop
Reviews.Author: Bouncinalong
Reviews.Content: Nice computer.  Fast, good looking, nice keyboard, I don't use the mousepad so I can't report on that.  It would get 5 stars if the battery pack didn't exceed the main form factor (kind of reminds me of a dragster with big back tires) but for my use it really doesn't matter.  A Firewire port would also be nice but given my application, not necessary. The fingerprint reader technology still needs a bit of work but it does work most of the time.  Can't give 4.8 stars so I rounded down.

Reviews.Title: Simply Great!
Reviews.Author: Quinn L
Reviews.Content: I just got this laptop for Christmas and i love it! It has worked very well. Let me just say Beats is the best!! best investment ever!

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: roland
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this team the truth a little uncomfortable by the size but I need for my work I noticed that heats but does not think it's a problem that can not be overcome, the truth is that this team so far filled my expectations
